name: C. Mixing Water
statement:
There are two infinite sources of water: hot water of temperature h;
cold water of temperature c (c < h). You perform the following procedure
of alternating moves: take cup of the water and pour it into an
infinitely deep barrel; take cup of the water and pour it into an
infinitely deep barrel; take cup of the water
dots and so on
dots .The barrel is initially empty. You have to pour into the barrel.
The water temperature in the barrel is an average of the temperatures of
the poured cups.You want to achieve a temperature as close as possible
to t. So if the temperature in the barrel is t_b, then the of t_b and t
(|t_b - t|) should be as small as possible.How many cups should you pour
into the barrel, so that the temperature in it is as close as possible
to t? If there are multiple answers with the minimum absolute
difference, then print the smallest of them.
